allow: Bash(# Let me check DEEPLY in node_modules grep -rn ""chkd-v2"" /Users/alex/chkd/node_modules --include=""*.json"")
Bash(# Check .gyp files and build configs grep -rn ""chkd-v2"" /Users/alex/chkd/node_modules --include=""*.gyp*"" --include=""config.gypi"" --include=""Makefile"")

Bash(# Check what tsx itself resolves to realpath /Users/alex/chkd/node_modules/tsx # Check if tsx has any cache ls -la /Users/alex/chkd/node_modules/.cache # Check the actual tsx version cat /Users/alex/chkd/node_modules/tsx/package.json)

Bash(# Let me check if the issue is the global npm link # The link points to /Users/alex/chkd but maybe there''s an issue with how it''s resolved # Check if there''s a ~/.tsx cache ls -la ~/.tsx || echo ""No ~/.tsx"" # Check node''s cache ls -la ~/.node*)
Bash(# Look for the path in npm''s metadata find ~/.npm -name ""*chkd*"")

Bash(# The error says ""imported from /Users/alex/chkd/"" # tsx''s resolve function is being called to resolve ""chkd-v2"" # This can only come from either: # 1. A cached module resolution in Node itself # 2. An import statement somewhere # 3. A config file # Check Node''s own cache directory ls -la ~/.node_repl_history)
Bash(# Check what''s actually in the global node_modules grep -rn ""chkd-v2"" /usr/local/lib/node_modules/chkd)

Bash(# Wait - the global package IS a symlink to /Users/alex/chkd # Let me check if there''s something ELSE in /usr/local/lib that has the old path grep -rn ""chkd-v2"" /usr/local/lib/node_modules --include=""*.json"")
Bash(# Let me take a different approach - find ALL files with chkd-v2 anywhere # Might take a moment but will find it find /Users/alex -name ""*.json"" -exec grep -l ""chkd-v2"" {} \\;)
Bash(# Wait for it wait find /Users/alex -name ""*.json"" -exec grep -l ""chkd-v2"" {} \\;)

Bash(# Different approach - check if there''s a symlink loop or resolution issue # What is Node''s actual view of the module? # Check if there''s a node_modules/.package-lock.json with cached paths cat /Users/alex/chkd/node_modules/.package-lock.json)
Bash(# The alias is the problem! Let me check where it''s defined grep -n ""chkd"" ~/.zshrc ~/.bashrc ~/.bash_profile ~/.profile)
Bash(# The alias is active but not in the standard files # Check other shell config files grep -rn ""chkd"" ~/.oh-my-zsh ~/.zsh*)
Bash(# Remove the alias for this session and test unalias chkd || true chkd status 2>&1)

Bash(# Search all potential shell config files for the alias grep -rn ""chkd"" ~/.zshrc ~/.bashrc ~/.bash_profile ~/.profile ~/.zprofile ~/.zshenv ~/.config/fish/config.fish ~/.aliases ~/.bash_aliases)
